meanings.definition: A device used to observe and study clouds.
meanings.sent1: The nephoscope helped the scientist study the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I used the nephoscope to observe the fluffy white clouds above.
meanings.sent3: The nephoscope seemed to have a magical power to reveal the secrets of the clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a nephoscope, scanning the sky for any sign of rain.
meanings.sent5: With the nephoscope, the clouds appeared closer and more detailed than ever before.

meanings.definition: To observe clouds using a nephoscope.
meanings.sent1: We nephoscoped the clouds to predict the weather for our picnic.
meanings.sent2: She loves to nephoscope the clouds whenever she has free time.
meanings.sent3: The children nephoscoped the clouds playfully, pretending to read their shapes like stories.
meanings.sent4: His mind would often nephoscope the clouds, lost in their ever-changing formations.
meanings.sent5: Nephoscoping the clouds became a calming ritual for him, a way to connect with nature.
